name: words-specified
text: Use approved words from the dictionary only as the specified part of speech.
explanation: In the dictionary, each approved word has a specified part of speech. When you use an approved word, make sure that you use it only as the specified part of speech.
notes: Examples illustrate both compliant and non-compliant use.

examples.description: Using 'test' only as the approved noun (not as a verb).
notes: 'test' is approved as a noun in our dictionary.
If verb use is needed, propose adding 'test' (verb) to the dictionary.

ste.text: Perform a test of the system.
ste.explanation: 'test' is a noun here, which matches the approved POS.

ste.text: Record the results of the test.

nonste.explanation: Verb usage of 'test' is not approved.

nonste.text: We will test the component tomorrow.

examples.description: Using 'control' only as the approved verb (not as a noun).

ste.text: Control the valve with the handle.

nonste.text: The control is on the front panel.
